sep.gaia.renderer.layer

Class ResourceAdapter<R extends DataResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.renderer.layer.ResourceAdapter<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of resources that should be processed by the adapter.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceObserver<R>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompassAdapter, CopyrightAdapter, MarkerAdapter, POIAdapter, TileAdapter, WeatherAdapter, WikipediaAdapter

    public abstract class ResourceAdapter<R extends DataResource>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceObserver<R>
    Class which instances receive updates about newly available resource from a DataResourceManager. Those resources can be processed and made fitting the requirements of the ddrawing layer.
    Author:
    Matthias Fisch

      ResourceAdapter()

      java.util.Collection<GLResource> getGLResources()
      Returns all converted resources that are current.

      Removes all GL-Resources currently stored in the adapter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceAdapter

        public ResourceAdapter()

    • Method Detail

      • onUpdate

        public abstract void onUpdate(java.util.Collection<R> resources)
        Method called when new resources are available. This method must be implemented and should make all elements in resources fitting the respective layer. Note that this method is called outside the OpenGL-thread and thus must not contain any OpenGL-specific calls.
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in interface ResourceObserver<R extends DataResource>
        Parameters:
        resources - The resources recently updated.

      • getGLResources

        public java.util.Collection<GLResource> getGLResources()
        Returns all converted resources that are current. Note that this call may block if converting is currently in progress.
        Returns:
        All converted resources that are current.

      • onClear

        public void onClear()
        Removes all GL-Resources currently stored in the adapter.
        Specified by:
        onClear in interface ResourceObserver<R extends DataResource>
